newsitem.title: HONG KONG: Turkey recognises future Hong Kong passport.
newsitem.headline: Turkey recognises future Hong Kong passport.

text.p: Turkey on Tuesday joined a growing list of countries that recognise the passports that Hong Kong will issue after the territory reverts to China on July 1, a government spokesman said.

Turkey would treat passports of the Hong Kong Special Administrative Region (SAR) the same as it currently treats a limited British document the British National Overseas passport, currently issued to many Hong Kong residents.

Turkey's gesture means holders of the future Hong Kong passport will be issued with three-month multiple entry visas upon arrival in Turkey, without advance formalities. The arrangement is reciprocal.
"This treatment is a strong vote of confidence in the HKSAR passport and signifies the commitment of the Turkish government to Hong Kong's continued success," the spokesman said.

A string of countries, including Britain, the United States, Australia, Canada, Singapore, Japan, Thailand, the Philippines, and West Samoa, have recognised the post-handover passport and announced favourable entry conditions ranging from easy visas to completely visa-free access.
Issuing its own travel document, Hong Kong is to become a mainly-autonomous region of China which has pledged to preserve its capitalist way of life and freedoms for 50 years.
